desc: Selection sort treats an array as two subarrays: one sorted and one unsorted. The sorted subarray begins empty. The algorithm iterates through the unsorted subarray and finds the smallest element. It then moves this element to the front of the unsorted array, now treating the sorted subarray as though it grew.
pseudo:
for i = 1 to length(arr) - 1
 min = i
 for j = i+1 to length(arr)
  if arr[j] < arr[min]
  min = j;
  if indexMin != i
  swap arr[min] and arr[i]
